#summary web.php api Documentation.

=web.php API Documentation=

This is web.php api documentation.

==Functions==

===post===

post - Route a HTTP POST-request to a controller

====Description====

||mixed *post* ( mixed _$path_ `[`, mixed _$func_ `]` )||

Routes HTTP POST request to a callable _$func_ if request URL path matches to _$path_. For each request this function can only execute one matched function.

====Parameters====

_path_

  ||A route on which request URL path is compared. If _$func_ is omitted _$path_ acts as a default controller.||

_func_

  ||A function to execute when request URL path is matched to _$path_.||
  
====Return Values====

Retuns the return value of the executed function.

====Examples====

=====Example #1 Using post function to route to a home page=====

{{{
// Route using an anonymous function
post('/', function() { echo 'Hello, World!' });

// Route using a static method
post('/', 'Controller::index');

// Route using an instance method
post('/', 'Controller->index');
}}}


====Notes====

*Note:* If a match is found, further calling this function doesn't do anything.

====See Also====

  * [get()] - Route a HTTP GET-request to a controller.
  * [put()] - Route a HTTP PUT-request to a controller.
  * [delete()] - Route a HTTP DELETE-request to a controller
  * [route()] - Route a any request to a controller
